metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: AppML using Google Cloud SQL
Google Cloud SQL is a database cloud service.
content.html: Google Cloud SQL is a database cloud service.

content.text: It is easy to set up and manage.
content.html: It is easy to set up and manage.

content.text: It is FREE to try!
content.html: It is FREE to try!

content.text: What is Google Cloud SQL
Google Cloud SQL is a cloud based database service.
content.html: Google Cloud SQL is a cloud based database service.

content.text: Why use Google Cloud SQL?
Google Cloud SQL offers MySQL databases deployed in the cloud without a fuss.
content.html: Google Cloud SQL offers MySQL databases deployed in the cloud without a fuss.

content.text: Google offers powerful databases that run fast, and flexible charging (pay per use).
content.html: Google offers powerful databases that run fast, and flexible charging (pay per use).

content.text: Google manages automated backups, patching, and recovery.
content.html: Google manages automated backups, patching, and recovery.

content.text: Getting Started
Before you can start using Google Cloud SQL, you need a Google account, and sign up for Google Developers Console.
content.html: Before you can start using Google Cloud SQL, you need a Google account, and sign up for Google Developers Console.

content.text: If you do not have a Google account you can sign up for one here: Create your Google Account
content.html: If you do not have a Google account you can sign up for one here: Create your Google Account

content.text: Sign Up for Google Developers Console
When you sign up for Google Developers Console, your Google account is automatically signed up for all services in Google Cloud, including SQL.
content.html: When you sign up for Google Developers Console, your Google account is automatically signed up for all services in Google Cloud, including SQL.

content.text: If you are a new Cloud Platform user, you can get started with a trial period for free.
content.html: If you are a new Cloud Platform user, you can get started with a trial period for free.

content.text: The Cloud Platform free trial allows you to try Cloud SQL for free for 60 days. For more information, see Cloud Platform Free Trial .
content.html: The Cloud Platform free trial allows you to try Cloud SQL for free for 60 days. For more information, see Cloud Platform Free Trial.

content.text: If you decide to continue with Cloud Platform after your free period (or if you need more storage or performance than the free usage tier offers), you only pay for the resources you use.
content.html: If you decide to continue with Cloud Platform after your free period (or if you need more storage or performance than the free usage tier offers), you only pay for the resources you use.

content.text: To create an Google Developers Console account go to: https://console.developers.google.com/freetrial , and follow the on-screen instructions.
content.html: To create an Google Developers Console account go to: https://console.developers.google.com/freetrial, and follow the on-screen instructions.

content.text: Create a MySQL Database Instance
In this example we will set up a Database instance running MySQL.
content.html: In this example we will set up a Database instance running MySQL.

content.text: Create a MySQL DB instance:
content.html: Create a MySQL DB instance:

content.text: Now you have a Google Cloud SQL database, with an IP that you can connect to.
content.html: Now you have a Google Cloud SQL database, with an IP that you can connect to.

content.html: To configure the database connection, edit the appml_config file:

content.html: AppML should now be configured to connect to your Google Cloud SQL database.
